name: Sébastien Loeb
bio: The most dominant rally driver in WRC history, Loeb won nine consecutive world titles starting in 2004. Known for his unmatched precision, he became synonymous with Citroën and tarmac perfection.

name: Petter Solberg
bio: The charismatic Norwegian won the 2003 WRC title for Subaru and was known for his flat-out driving style, consistent pace, and strong performances across gravel and tarmac.

name: Marcus Grönholm
bio: A two-time world champion (2000, 2002), Grönholm was the dominant force for Peugeot and later Ford. He was especially feared on fast gravel stages like Finland.

name: Mikko Hirvonen
bio: Hirvonen came closest to dethroning Loeb, finishing runner-up multiple times. A consistent, smooth driver and Ford’s lead man during the late 2000s.

name: Jari-Matti Latvala
bio: The youngest WRC winner at the time, Latvala burst onto the scene in 2008. Known for his speed and raw talent, he became a long-term Ford and later Toyota star.

name: Markko Märtin
bio: Estonia’s greatest rally driver of the era, Märtin delivered fast, technical performances for Ford and Peugeot, including landmark wins in Finland and Corsica.

name: François Duval
bio: A Belgian talent with flashes of brilliance, Duval was known for his speed on tarmac and for challenging the top tier during his time with Ford and Citroën.

name: Henning Solberg
bio: Petter Solberg’s brother, Henning was a consistent performer for Ford and Subaru, known for his tenacity and ability to score points in tough conditions.

name: Daniel Sordo
bio: A Spanish driver who became a key part of Citroën’s lineup, Sordo was known for his smooth driving style and strong performances on tarmac.

name: Gigi Galli
bio: An Italian driver known for his flamboyant style and speed, Galli made a name for himself with memorable performances in the late 2000s.

name: Chris Atkinson
bio: An Australian driver who made a name for himself with Subaru, Atkinson was known for his speed on tarmac and ability to score points in tough conditions.

name: Matthew Wilson
bio: A British driver who competed for Ford, Wilson was known for his consistency and ability to score points in the WRC.
